channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Record-breaking heat wave will send temperatures soaring for days
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Witness tells House Ethics Committee that Gaetz paid her for sex: Sources
item.description: The committee has interviewed at least half a dozen women who were witnesses in the DOJ case.

item.title: Will Wichita State University proceed with plan to alter campus? We’ll know this week
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Putin and Kim show off "fiery friendship," pledge unity against U.S.
item.description: Russia's Vladimir Putin pays a rare visit to North Korea, where he and Kim Jong Un vow to jointly fight "the imperialist hegemonistic policies of the U.S."

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Immigrant families rejoice over Biden's expansive move toward citizenship, while some are left out
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of immigrants had reason to rejoice when President Joe Biden unveiled a highly expansive plan to extend legal status to spouses of U.S. citizens but, inevitably, some were left out

item.title: Poisoned trees gave a wealthy couple in Maine a killer ocean view. Residents wonder, at what cost?
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Texas doctor charged with taking patient records on transgender care
item.description: Dr. Eithan Haim, a 34-year-old surgeon, pleaded not guilty to charges that he illegally obtained confidential patient records on transgender care from Texas Children's Hospital in Houston.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: US soldier sentenced to Russian penal colony, local media reports
item.description: Gordon Black, the U.S. soldier arrested in Russia in May, was sentenced on Wednesday to nearly 4 years in a Russian Penal Colony, local media reported.

item.title: Chinese automakers seek retaliatory tariffs on EU cars, state media reports
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Woman tried to rescue husband who died by hot tub electrocution, suit says
item.description: Lizette Zambrano jumped in to rescue her drowning husband, then was jolted by the current and sucked in, too, according to the lawsuit.

item.title: Confessions of a 1980s flight attendant
item.description: Ann Hood, a best-selling author, has recounted her adventures working as cabin crew on TWA flights in the 1980s in a book detailing the highs and lows of life during the early jet age.

item.title: WATCH: 105-year-old Stanford University student earns master's degree
item.description: Virginia “Ginger” Hislop, who is 105 years old, finally earned her master's degree eight decades after enrolling at Stanford University.

item.title: Baby moose trapped in a lake is saved by Alaska man and police as its worried mom watches
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 6/18: CBS Evening News
item.description: Fast-spreading wildfires force evacuation of New Mexico town; How the lineage of one African-American family was traced back to 1789

item.title: June 13, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The US-backed Gaza ceasefire proposal doesn't meet Hamas' demands for an end to the war, a senior official has told CNN. Osama Hamdan also said that "no one has an idea" how many of the hostages held in the enclave are alive.

item.title: Baby moose trapped in a lake is saved by Alaska man and police as its worried mom watches
item.description: An Alaska man and two police officers have joined forces to rescue a baby moose that got stuck between a floatplane and a dock in a lake

item.title: Attorneys for Baltimore seek to keep crew members from bridge collapse ship from returning home
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: U.S. soldier gets almost 4 years on theft, murder threats charges in Russia
item.description: A Russian court sentenced American soldier Gordon Black almost four years in prison on charges of stealing and threats of murder, Russian news reports said.
